availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Seaton (Boyd County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier.)

body.p: Boyd County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier. Medina County, Ohio, native. Son of R. P. Seaton and Frances Abbot Seaton. Married to Mary Allen Womack in Catlettsburg on September 3, 1863. Clerk in Boyd County, Kentucky, in 1860. Clerk in Boyd County in 1863. Served in the 45th Kentucky Mounted Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A) as first lieutenant and adjutant from November 10, 1863, to December 24, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyd County, Catlettsburg, p. 815.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, Precinct 8, p. 181B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0439.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, KY, September 1863, p. 530.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 7063.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, X County Marriages, Film 000344011.
